Summary: Routing-based navigation using Shell. Compose hierarchical items (FlyoutItem, ShellContent, Tab) and navigate via routes (Shell.Current.GoToAsync), with on-demand page loading and strongly-typed props.
Remarks: Shell is the .NET MAUI control for structured, route-driven navigation. In MauiReactor you compose the Shell with items and optionally attach routes to them (or register routes via Routing.RegisterRoute<TComponent>()). Navigate between pages with MauiControls.Shell.Current.GoToAsync("//route") and use ".." to go back. You can render pages on demand by providing a callback to ShellContent.RenderContent(() => ContentPage(...)). To pass parameters, call GoToAsync<TProps>(route, configureProps) and read the values in the destination component’s Props. For complex apps, prefer Shell over NavigationPage as it provides URIs, deep links, and menu/flyout support.
